page.title: 08Churches-Anglican (C)
page.content: Our area contains 3 C of E parishes belonging to the Diocese of Blackburn. The Bishop of Lancaster, Venerable Ian Harland,was consecrated in May 1985. Christ Church,the oldest building,dates from 1857.Built to an unusual design by Henry Martin it is distingiushed by two towers topped by graceful spires.The Baptistry is a feature,also the Great West Window.Originally the building housed 600 but has been altered and now holds 300.There are 4 Sunday services and one every week day.The Vicar is Rev J.Burns.St Paul's Scotforth is a town parish,founded in 1876.The church holds 350 people.Rev.D.G.Bellinger is the Vicar.There are services every day.St. Peter's,Quernmore is a rural parish near the centre of a village of about 570 people.Built in 1860 the church holds 300 people.The Vicar is Rev.L.J. Haikes.
